description: Unique in its kind, highly customizable themed taskbars

I install it on all machines I load Ubuntu, and that now includes 20.04 LTS. The simplest & easiest way I have found is to install the dock from "Software Updater", then open a terminal and type "sudo apt-get dist-upgrade". It greatly reduces the learning curve for windows users and those not very savory with computers. I have two gentleman in their 70's that refuse to use windows, but will use Ubuntu because of the dock and the Vivaldi browser which is much faster and more custoable than Firefox which is packaged with Ubuntu. . Regardless, have yet to have an issue with it. Just like Ubuntu, it simply works. Only complaint I have is the option to add the dock to startup has never worked for me. Therefore, I use "Startup Application" in ubuntu, and add the command "/usr/bin/cairo-dock", along with "Cairo-Dock" for the name, and "cairo-dock-startup in compter" for the comment. If I was a programmer, I would join the community project to contribute the needed code for the option to load the dock during startup. Hopefully my suggestion in this post will help some users.
125% ratio 2256x1504 3:2 13.5 inch display does NOT wotrk. I have to delete it and find another dock, sorry, 100% ratio is working but too small.

when i install and open this app, a small sized window was opened. and the window never closed 'til system reboot.

Das Dock lässt sich bestens handhaben. Look & Feel begeistert sofort. Nach kurzer Anlernphase so strukturiert, dass alle Anwendungen und Verknüpfung untergebracht werden können.
summary: Bestes Lok & Feel für den Desktop
